var::Ring Class Reference

Documentation

Ring is a ring buffer (or circular buffer) that uses a local memory buffer for the data.

Public Member Functions

size_t calc_free () const
 
size_t calc_used () const

void var::Ring::flush ( void  )

Empty the buffer

bool var::Ring::is_overflow_allowed ( ) const
inline

Access whether or not buffer allows overwriting The default value for overflow allowed is true. Use set_overflow_allowed(false) to disable overflow.

int var::Ring::read ( u8 *  buf,
size_t  nbytes 
)

Read data from the ring buffer

Parameters
bufA pointer to the destination data buffer
nbytesThe number of bytes to read
Returns
void var::Ring::set_overflow_allowed ( bool  value = true)
inline

Set whether or not overflow is allowed in the buffer

If overflow is allowed, write() will always write and return nbytes as specified. If overflow is not allowed, write() will only write until the buffer is full.

Parameters
valueTrue to allow overflow or false to disallow it.
size_t var::Ring::size ( ) const
inline

Access the size of the buffer
